src/lib/components/Dash_react_table.reac.description:
DashReactTable is a decalaritive version of react-table, built for dash.

At a minimum, it must have `data` and `column` properties.
`data` must be a uniform list of dicts with the arbitrary amount of keys representing the 
columns and values representing that row's data. This can be done very easily 
in pandas using df.to_json(orient='records'). As for `columns`, this is also a list
of dictionaries, but it has a defined set of properties. At the very least, it must contain 
`Header` and `accessor` properties, referring to the column's title and identifying key in 
the data property, respectively. Columns also have many other properties that are referenced 
both in the docstring as well as in the react-table docs.

id.description: The ID used to identify this component in Dash callbacks

data.description:
An array of dictionaries with each dictionary corresponding 
to a row. The keys will refere to columns while the values refer
to the data that will be placed in that row's cell.

accessor.name: string
accessor.description:
The corresponding key that links 
the column to the data array.

width.name: number
width.description: A hardcoded width for the column. This overides both min and max width options

minWidth.name: number
minWidth.description: A minimum width for the column (default: 100)

maxWidth.name: number
maxWidth.description: A maximum width for the column

className.name: string
className.description: Class name for the cells of this column.

style.name: object
style.description: Inline style for the cells of this column.

headerClassName.name: string
headerClassName.description: Class name for the header of this column.

headerStyle.name: object
headerStyle.description: Inline style for the header of this column.

columns.description:
An aray of dictionaries containing properties to each column. 
At the very least, every column must have a "Header" and "accessor" 
property. The "Header" will be the title of the column and the "accessor"
will link that column to the data array of dictionaries.

showPagination.description:
Turn on pagination. Seting this to true will improve performance
on larger tables.

showPaginationTop.description: Show pagination controls on top of table (default: false)

showPaginationBottom.description: Show pagination controls on bottom of table (default: true)

showPageSizeOptions.description: Show options dropdown to edit results per page when pagination is enabled.

pageSizeOptions.description: Options for show page size when pageination is enabled. (default: [5, 10, 20, 25, 50, 100])

minRows.description:
controls the minimum number of rows to display - default will be "pageSize"
NOTE: if you set minRows to 0 then you get rid of empty padding rows BUT your table formatting will also 
look strange when there are ZERO rows in the table.

sortable.description: Table level sorting (default: true). This can be overided for specific columns.

resizable.description: Table level resizing (default: true). This can be overided for specific columns.

filterable.description: Table level filtering (default: false). This can be overided for specific columns.

className.description: Add classname "-striped" and/or "-highlight" to enable these features.

setProps.description:
Dash-assigned callback that should be called whenever any of the
properties change
